title: It works but can be a pain
comment: Connecting the camera requires a switch of model a few times to get a solid connection.  Once connected most is OK, the camera allows you control still to set the framing correct before starting the auto time lapse shutter.  Main downside is, the app and phone need to be on for it to work, if the phone goes on standby, so does your time lapse. The picture count is a lie, it counts how many pictures should have taken in the given configuration instead of the actual count, which sometimes is less.

title: Great app for RX100II

title: Works but with some minor niggles
comment: I've wanted to do timelapse with my NEX 5r for a while. The app 'does what it says on the tin.' I can connect via the camera's wifi to the phone/app and then set the duration and number of images to take etc... Start the process and everything carries on as you would expect.  However it seems that every 10-15 minutes or so, the connection gets dropped forcing you to restart the process from scratch.   Also It would be nice to be able to change settings, such as using RAW instead of JPG, being able to select Ap or Tv or whatever. I've fopund my Camera stuck in Jpg mode and the only thing i can change is either ISO or the exposure. More control please!

title: For basic timelapses on the RX100 ii this is great!

comment: Works great with Sony DSX-WX80 using the Sony DSC-HX50V profile. The developer was quick to feedback when I asked about support for my camera.

title: Great App for proof of concept
comment: Great app, but it puts my rx100m2 in auto focus and exposure. I wanted it in manual. Too bad the minimum interval is 5 seconds.  I think this is because of the limitations of using a WiFi interface? Had problem with my nexus 5 sleeping with extremely long interval & days of duration until I installed a "Stay Alive" app.
Yes on rx100 mk2 there is too much limitations due to Sony's interface on Camera :( I pray for a new firmware...

title: Pretty good, could be better.
comment: What I am hoping for is a way to take several photos in a row that are longer than 30- seconds in length.  Please implement this.  Thanks.
https://github.com/ThibaudM/timelapse-sony#frequently-asked-questions

title: Thibaud Michel  WE NEED YOU !!!
comment: Your Sony Timelapse App for Droid is over the top! You've done what Sony either couldn't or wouldn't do. The speed of connectivity on my Nex-6 is amazing, the control flawless. Would you PLEASE consider turning your talents in the direction of HDR. Sony has never gotten it that some photographers want easy bracketing without touching the camera. Always they imbed the timer shutter release within the bracketing menu so you cannot use both at the same time-forcing you to have to press the shutter :( Thanks for you time and effort. I see you don't charge for the TimeLapse App but know some of us really appreciate what you have done for the Nex's and the A7r.

title: Awesome stuff - needs a couple of minor fixes
comment: First off, works better than advertised, allows you to take great timelapses using the WiFi functionality that Sony is doing nothing to promote. The interface  is very easy to operate and is laid out in neat steps that even novices should have no trouble with. Kudos Michel for making this amazing app. Just a couple of points of feedback   1. It starts to falter when the shutter speed is longer than the interval between the shots. So if I need to take 15sec shots continuously (interval between shots=0) I need to set the interval to 33sec (15sec shot, 15sec for the noise reduction shot, 3 sec for misc delays). But since the app is sending only the shoot command I'm not sure how this can be improved  2. When the screen turns off in long time lapse sequences the interval between the shots starts getting longer than the set value. Perhaps due to android trying to hibernate the app  3. It would be great if you could allow the app to set the camera settings in manual (f value, shutter speed and ISO) this will also tell the app how long the cam will be taking a shot and the app can respond accordingly  Just my 2cents to an absolutely amazing and much needed app

title: I have been looking for a solution for my RX100m2 for a long time...
comment: Thank you for writing this app...i was thinking of doing this on my own if no one put an app out soon.  Only thing that would be a great addition would be bulb ramping, though i'm not sure it's even possible.   Edit: Still keeping this at five stars but i do have an issue to report.  Whenever my screen turns off it usually delays the start of the next shutter.  One time it delayed it for roughly 5 minutes, so in the end the camera was supposed to be done with pictures 15 minutes before it actually was.  Just thought i'd bring this up.  Is there a forum for this?

title: Just what I needed!
comment: I think a great update would include a time lapse calculator, which would calculate how long you have to wait for to finish your time lapse for a set finished time/frames per second/time between exposures.

It's plan but it will just be a sample.
I choosed to use the phone just as an helper for the camera for 2 reasons:
- Your phone processor can't replace your computer. Link HD pictures costs a lot (processor + battery life)
- Some desktop app do it easily and very well with a lot of params

title: A life saver!
comment: Having just bought my Alpra 7r I was in dire need of a timelapse solution. The Sony playmemories app is awful and there are no good remote intervalometers for the Alpha 7 yet.  This app is perfect! Simple, effective. Does exactly what I need it to do. Trigger the shutter at a set interval.  Thank you! I look forward to continue development on it. :)

title: Thank you for providing something Sony should
